section.title: Amazon AMI
section.para: To run SteamCannon on Amazon EC2, start an instance of ${ami.us-east} in the us-east-1 region. The c1.medium instance size is recommended; m1.small may also be used but will take much longer to boot. SteamCannon does not support t1.micro at this time. Make sure the instance is started in a security group that allows tcp traffic over port 8080.

section.title: VMware Appliance
section.para: To run SteamCannon in a desktop VMware product (Fusion, Workstation, Player) download the VMware Appliance for version ${project.version}. Extract the downloaded .tgz file and open steamcannon.vmx in VMware. The root user's password is 'boxgrinder'.

section.title: Create a New User
section.para: Open http://ip_address_of_appliance:8080 in your web browser and click the Register link under the Login button to create a new user. All appliances are configured for open registration, meaning anyone that can access the SteamCannon running on that appliance can create an account.

section.title: Enter AWS Credentials
section.para: After registering, you'll be prompted to enter your Amazon Web Services (AWS) credentials. If you don't already have credentials, you'll need to sign up for an AWS account. Note that Amazon places very low quotas on newly-created AWS accounts so you may have to wait several hours after registering to successfully start an environment.
